intro: Machilus obovatifolius var. taiwuensis, commonly known as the Taiwu machilus, is a rare evergreen shrub or small tree native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by oval, woody fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
